Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare the pie crusts in 3 pie pans and set them aside.
Combine the eggs, sugar, melted butter, flour, and vanilla extract in a bowl, stirring until smooth. Mix in 1 cup of cream. Divide the mixture evenly among the pie crusts.
Bake for about 35 minutes in the preheated oven or until the filling is set. Allow the pies to cool, then trim off any excess pie crust to the top of the filling.

Cook a mixture of brown sugar, 1 cup of cream, and 1/2 cup of sugar in a heavy saucepan over medium-low heat until it reaches 140 degrees F/60 degrees C, stirring constantly, or drops into cold water forms a soft ball.
Stir until thickened and cool. Blend in butter and vanilla extract, beating until smooth and butter is well combined. This should result in a thin, smooth icing consistency.
Stack the 3 glazed pies atop one another, and spread the remaining caramel glaze on the top pie. Cool until set before serving.
